intro: Tetraneuris torreyana, commonly known as Torrey's tetraneuris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blossoms. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. Tetraneuris torreyana is often found in scrublands and chaparral ecosystems, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
